TITLE: Syllabus
DEF: The key document that governs course objectives, assignments, grading, and incorporates supporting policies
TASK: A syllabus is a comprehensive document outlining course objectives, expectations, assignments, grading policies, and resources. The purpose of a syllabus is to serve as a clear, concise guide for students and instructors alike. Supporting policies are integrated by reference. To create an effective syllabus, address common issues such as accessibility, flexibility, and relevance to ensure a meaningful learning experience.
